poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: A sheep tick engorged in my forearm, Its wings like an artichoke leaves sticking up? but here's the trick: it was a cyclamen. Now root it up gently; there's Barely a graze, There's hardly a tic of discomfort, And carry it, rinky tink tink, to the house. Is that borage or cress on my bicep?
